txt.en: The entrance to the Boar-tribe lair is south of Beaconwatch, not far from the Mering-Stream.\n\nCúthing wants you to travel to the Boar-tribe lair and defeat the chieftain.
Defeat Pakon, the Maldorr Orc-chieftain
'Sauron grows impatient with you, Orc.'
Reclaim the skull of the Boar of Everholt
'Fear is not enough; they need to be defeated.'
Defeated Pakon, the Maldorr Orc-chieftain
Defeat Pakon, the Maldorr Orc-chieftain
You have arrived at the entrance of the Boar-tribe Orc-lair
Cúthing is standing near Meregyth, outside the Mead Hall of Beaconwatch.\n\nYou should return to Beaconwatch and tell Cúthing about your victory.
The Boar-tribe chieftain is somewhere within their lair.\n\nIf you encounter the chieftain of the Boar-tribe, defeat him.
Defeated Pakon, the Maldorr Orc-chieftain
Talk to Cúthing

'The Boar-tribe Orcs were in league with a Nazgûl? It appears that there is more to these Orcs than it first seemed. We must remain vigilant; however, this threat has been quelled for now.\n\n'We cannot thank you enough, [placeholder]. We would not have been able to repel the Orcs without you.'
'Our plan is in motion. The people of Eastfold fear us.'
'We will not fail Sauron.'

'I wish I could go with you, but my wounds will only prove to be a hindrance. I do not know the Orcs' numbers, but you have demonstrated that you are more than equipped to handle them.\n\n'Head to the south of Beaconwatch, and not far from the Mering-stream, you will find the main entrance to their lair. Once inside, look for the Boar-tribe chieftain and defeat him.'
The Boar-tribe chieftain is somewhere within their lair.\n\nIf you encounter the chieftain of the Boar-tribe, defeat him.
Cúthing's plan calls for a single person to sneak into the Boar-tribe Orc-lair and defeat their chieftain.
Defeat Pakon, the Maldorr Orc-chieftain
Breaking the Back of the Boar
Travel to the Boar-tribe Orc-lair
